dspace-development.title: [oar] Test and Troubleshoot the OAI-PMH Endpoint

comments.body:
This has been successfully released into the `production` environment:
![image](https://github.com/pulibrary/dspace-development/assets/1443986/9264273b-9af3-40c3-acc6-762c3d0db547)

Please note that it was necessary to recopy the JAR dependencies after multiple attempts to restart the `tomcat` service. Further, the following needed to be explicitly copied:
```bash
$ cp /dspace/webapps/rest/WEB-INF/lib/joda-time-2.3.jar /dspace/webapps/oai/WEB-INF/lib/
```

dspace-development.title: Change DataSpace banner to include more information of disabled submissions

comments.body:
@astrochun may I suggest this new banner language:

> Princeton's Research Data Repository is becoming the Princeton Data Commons! As we transition, you may not see some of the collections you were once able to submit to in DataSpace, and that means Princeton Data Commons is ready for you. If you are intending to publish from the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory and you have questions about the new submission process, please contact [publications@pppl.gov](mailto:publications@pppl.gov). For all other questions about getting started with submissions to Princeton Data Commons, please contact [prds@princeton.edu](mailto:prds@princeton.edu). For more information, please visit the [Princeton Research Data Service website](https://researchdata.princeton.edu/introducing-princeton-data-commons).

> @astrochun may I suggest this new banner language:
> 
> > Princeton's Research Data Repository is becoming the Princeton Data Commons! As we transition, you may not see some of the collections you were once able to submit to in DataSpace, and that means Princeton Data Commons is ready for you. If you are intending to publish from the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory and you have questions about the new submission process, please contact [publications@pppl.gov](mailto:publications@pppl.gov). For all other questions about getting started with submissions to Princeton Data Commons, please contact [prds@princeton.edu](mailto:prds@princeton.edu). For more information, please visit the [Princeton Research Data Service website](https://researchdata.princeton.edu/introducing-princeton-data-commons).

Do we want to modify the emails so we can't be spammed? Otherwise, looks good @matthewjchandler and @kelynch.

@astrochun Do you have a preferred modification? E.g. publications[at]pppl[dot]gov? Or just remove the mailto link? PRDS is usually pretty free about putting its mailto email address up online, and we deal with the spam.

> @astrochun Do you have a preferred modification? E.g. publications[at]pppl[dot]gov? Or just remove the mailto link? PRDS is usually pretty free about putting its mailto email address up online, and we deal with the spam.

Removing the mailto should suffice. I don't want it to be more cumbersome for the researchers.

@jrgriffiniii Here's the new text we want for the DataSpace banner ASAP:

> Princeton's Research Data Repository is becoming the Princeton Data Commons! As we transition, you may not see some of the collections you were once able to submit to in DataSpace, and that means Princeton Data Commons is ready for you. If you are intending to publish from the Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory and you have questions about the new submission process, please contact publications@pppl.gov. For all other questions about getting started with submissions to Princeton Data Commons, please contact prds@princeton.edu. For more information, please visit the [Princeton Research Data Service website](https://researchdata.princeton.edu/introducing-princeton-data-commons).

### Completion Criteria
- [ ] The new text reads as in the block quote in this comment
- [ ] The email addresses are NOT clickable links in the banner (despite how they're rendered here in GitHub)
- [ ] The link to the "Princeton Research Data Service website" (https://researchdata.princeton.edu/introducing-princeton-data-commons) IS clickable, as rendered here in GitHub

pdc_discovery.title: Our plausible account seems to be disabled?

comments.body:
@kelynch the new key in staging seems to be OK...making a call to Plausible does not return an error:

```
deploy@pdc-discovery-staging1:/opt/pdc_discovery/current$ bundle exec rails c
Loading staging environment (Rails 6.1.7.4)                                     
irb(main):001:0> Plausible.pageviews(174742)
=> 0
```

whereas the same call in production results in an error:

```
deploy@pdc-discovery-prod1:/opt/pdc_discovery/current$ bundle exec rails c
Loading production environment (Rails 6.1.7.4)
irb(main):001:0> Plausible.pageviews(174742)
PLAUSIBLE ERROR: (Pageviews for document: 174742) {"error":"The account that owns this API key does not have access to Stats API. Please make sure you're using the API key of a subscriber account and that the subscription plan includes Stats API"}
=> 0
```

There are no statistics at all in staging, though. But i looks like this has been the case for a very long time:

![Screenshot 2024-02-05 at 4 24 10 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/pdc_discovery/assets/568286/7bc9876b-c24d-4cf0-94b7-795813c4c1b2)

I suspect we can safely update production with the new keys and test over there.

tiger-data-app.title: Adding an accumulator task so folks can create accumulators

comments.body:
Note: If an accumulator is added to a project after assets have already been added/generated -- We will need to regenerate the accumulator to add all previously created files/collections to the count.

The request in the console... 
`asset.collection.accumulator.all.generate :id [_collection_id_]   `

tiger-data-app.title: SPIKE: how to query mediaflux for file size range?

comments.body:
I will take about 8 seconds to query 200k records
```
td-meta1 >  asset.query :collection 1734250 :action range :xpath content/size
	:value -nbe "189050"
		:min "0"
		:max "345890"
```

About the same 8 seconds...
```
td-meta1 >  asset.query :collection 1734250 :action range :xpath ctime
	:value -nbe "215978"
		:min "Wed Sep 20 12:36:54 EDT 2023"
		:max "Wed Sep 20 12:36:57 EDT 2023"
```

tiger-data-app.title: SPIKE: how to query mediaflux for date modified range

comments.body:
This query takes about 8 seconds, but fulfills the request.
```
td-meta1 >  asset.query :collection 1734250 :action range :xpath mtime
	:value -nbe "215978"
		:min "Thu Nov 12 04:50:34 EST 1981"
		:max "Mon Mar 15 04:31:33 EDT 2021"
```

```
asset.query :collection 1734250 :action get-path  :where "type='application/arc-asset-collection'"

	:path -id "1734631" -version "1" "/princeton/tigerdata/projectg/1/7/7/3/17734/17734-h"

	:path -id "1735025" -version "1" "/princeton/tigerdata/projectg/1/7/7/3/17739"

```

comments.body: Instead of calculating the total number of files and collections every time a page is visited -- which will take an extreme amount of time with an extreme amount of files -- use an accumulator to store the value and query that.

tiger-data-app.title: SPIKE: Use docker-compose to integrate mediaflux into our CI build

comments.body:
First I tried pushing our mediaflux image to a private dockerhub account and incorporating it into the CI build. This worked, except that the docker image does not publish to port 8888 by default, we are doing that via the `$ docker create --name mediaflux --publish 0.0.0.0:8888:8888 princeton_dev:23.08.25` command, and I don't see a way to add that `--publish` bit into the circleci config. What we end up with is an instance of mediaflux that we can't talk to. 

![Screenshot 2024-02-05 at 4 39 25 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/tiger-data-app/assets/65608/bd65fcec-764b-48ce-ae56-9ccf0dfbb035)


![Screenshot 2024-02-05 at 4 21 03 PM](https://github.com/pulibrary/tiger-data-app/assets/65608/58f52faf-2741-4e64-8b1c-708702030f8f)

How to dockerize a rails application: https://semaphoreci.com/community/tutorials/dockerizing-a-ruby-on-rails-application

Then I think we could use docker-compose to bring up mediaflux beside our rails app on circleci.

tiger-data-app.title: First pass at fetching file information
Fix mediaflux query to include all children and sub-collections

comments.body:
@carolyncole it looks like there is a reason we are not using the `:collection` parameter to query. There is a bug in Mediaflux that prevents pagination from working when we use the `:collection` parameter.

See note here: https://github.com/pulibrary/tiger-data-app/blob/main/app/models/mediaflux/http/query_request.rb#L51-L53

You can reproduce the bug as follows:

```
asset.query :collection 1098 :idx 3 :size 3
 :id -version "1" "1099"
    :id -version "1" "1100"
    :id -version "1" "1101"
    :cursor
        ...

asset.query :collection 1098 :idx 4 :size 3
    :id -version "1" "1099"
    :id -version "1" "1100"
    :id -version "1" "1101"
    :cursor
        ...
```

Notice how Mediaflux returned the exact same asset ids even when we asked for the second page of results.
